name: K2-31
scenarioDescription:
The K2-31 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-31 is a star with 0.91 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.78 times its radius. It is located 361.60915719999997 light years away from the solar system.

K2-31 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-31 system

K2-31 b

K2-31 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the Transit method. The mass of K2-31 b is 563.83042 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-31 b is 11.882 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-31 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, K2-31 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-31, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by K2.
